definition: to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: No one in the bar appears surprised to see a disabled person dancing.
sentences.chinese: 看到希福跳舞，酒吧里的人似乎一点都不吃惊。

sentences.english: At this point of time, Hanwen arrives to arrest Shouye.
sentences.chinese: 这时汉文与伟民前来拘捕守业，众人吃惊。

sentences.english: Three surprising things came out of Starr’s testimony.
sentences.chinese: 斯塔尔的证词中有三处令人吃惊。

sentences.english: A girl passed close to him, and Lieutenant Blandford started.
sentences.chinese: 一个女孩靠近他走过，布兰佛德中尉吃惊地动了一下。

sentences.english: Then, to my sur-prise, he hugged me.
sentences.chinese: 然后，让我吃惊的是，他拥抱了我。

sentences.english: The appearance of the whale has stunned marine biologists.
sentences.chinese: 这头灰鲸的让海洋生物学家大为吃惊。

sentences.english: It’s astonishing what great teachers can do for their students.
sentences.chinese: 优秀教师对自己学生所做的令人吃惊。

sentences.english: To their surprise, the so-called investor is a swindler.
sentences.chinese: 令他们吃惊的是，那个所谓的投资商是骗子。

sentences.english: The first thing that struck Georgiana when entering the laboratory was the hot furnace.
sentences.chinese: 走进实验室后第一件让她吃惊的事便是里面的暖气。

sentences.english: She was gobsmacked to find that the man in black coat was her classmate of primary school.
sentences.chinese: 她吃惊的发现那个穿黑外套的男人是她的小学同学。

sentences.english: “The speed of change, ” wrote Wilcox, “is astonishing.”
sentences.chinese: 威尔科克斯写到，“变化的速度令人吃惊。”
她的厚颜使我大为吃惊。

sentences.english: The result is quite a shocker but I am not surprised.
sentences.chinese: 结果是有点出乎意料，但我却不太吃惊。

sentences.english: Cinderella was astonished as the mice changed into horses.
sentences.chinese: 当这些老鼠变成马匹的时候，灰姑娘感到吃惊。

sentences.english: The reasons for the new American austerity are subtler, but not shocking.
sentences.chinese: 美国紧缩新政的原因更为微妙，但并不令人吃惊。

definition: to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to not understand/to be puzzled by/indissoluble
